definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon

sentences.english: Her achievement had crowds flinging confetti and chanting in Iraqi streets.
sentences.chinese: 她的成就使得伊拉克的群众在街上抛掷纸花，喊叫。

sentences.english: At first, e-mails were written on rocks and thrown at neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 起初，邮件是被刻在石头上而后抛掷给邻居们。

sentences.english: Another is to throw two prayer blocks that look like crescent moons.
sentences.chinese: 另一个方法则是抛掷两个新月状的筊杯。

sentences.english: All the people that love you, don't cast them aside.
sentences.chinese: 所有那些爱你的人，不要将他们抛掷一旁。

sentences.english: The sea is the inexorable social night into which the penal laws fling their condemned.
sentences.chinese: 海，就是冷酷无情的法律抛掷它牺牲品的总渊薮。
生活向我们抛掷弧线球。

sentences.english: Later the bride throws her bouquet of flowers to a group of single girls.
sentences.chinese: 稍后新娘向一堆单身女青年抛掷鲜花。

definition: to throw sth a long distance/to hurl/to throw at/to throw (dice etc)/to flip (a coin)
to catch (sth thrown etc)/to receive (sth given)/to accept
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
